comments:
I thought I already reported this, but for the life of me I can't find the bug report.

This is occurring on Eclipse 3.1.1 in the Text Editor. I've had the editor open for hours now working on a fairly large file. Suddenly, I'm getting this exception logged many times and the editor is no longer reliably responding to key strokes:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.filebuffers.SynchronizableDocument.replace(SynchronizableDocument.java:133)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.gtk_commit(Control.java:2383)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.windowProc(Widget.java:1476)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java:4234)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java:4234)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java:3973)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_main_do_event(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_main_do_event(OS.java:5593)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.eventProc(Display.java:1192)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._g_main_context_iteration(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.g_main_context_iteration(OS.java:1487)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2969)

Is it really 3.1.1? And yes, you already reported a similar bug which we cannot reproduce (see bug 205589).

Could you try to provide steps? Is Jazz extending the text editor in a way that this could happen, e.g. are you using your own quick diff provider?

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 205589 ***
